website_summaries.verdict: An effective insect trap that is ideal for small to medium areas and is energy efficient, but the downside to it catching lots of insects is the need to replace the glue board that is part of what makes it work so well.
pros: Combines a UV light, fan, and glue board to lure and trap insects
USB power port allows you to run it efficiently off any compatible device or power pack
Earns praise for its effectiveness for infestations of small insects such as fruit flies
cons: Replacement glue boards can get costly

customer_reviews.title: Taking care of our fly problem
customer_reviews.text: Working great so far! I needed it mainly to catch the house flies that are plaguing our kitchen as the weather is warming up, but we have fruit fly/gnats too so I figured if they didn’t catch the house flies at least we’d get the little ones. There are 7 house flies in it right now! I’m so far pretty satisfied. Will leave it on overnight and see what else we get!
customer_reviews.author: S Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Does it work? Yes. But the replacement glue boards are pricey for what they are and how fast they need replacing if you have a gnat problem. You can use the unit without the glue board but I find that those tiny gnats don't seem to get caught as well without the glue trap at the bottom. I'm very disappointed as I could have sworn the glue traps were half the current price when I bought the unit just a few weeks ago! So 4 stars for working well and having good customer service... but minus one star for being pretty noisy on the high setting and cost of the replacement glue traps after initial purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: did not catch one mosquito or fruite fly , i tried it for a week
customer_reviews.author: Diya

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to catch the house flies and it does catch them. Why did I give it only 3 stars? It only works in the dark. In day light, it doesn't do a thing. Even in the dark, the flies sit under the light and hang in there. Takes a long time (hours) they actually go in the trap. If you happen to touch the trap while the fly is sitting under the light, they escape. So I give 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michaella

customer_reviews.title: Noisy af and useless
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars if you have fruit flies 1 star house flies 1 star because noisey af
customer_reviews.author: james gaudet

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Either I have the supermen of fruit flies or this thing just plain doesn't work. I'm thinking I have normal fruit flies. I bought this thing with high hopes and wanted to really test it out so I put it next to my small collection of cans and bottles which seems to be like a fruit fly water cooler. After many hours of running on high strength. I think there was 1 on the sticky disk. I bought this based on the positive reviews. I dont know what these people are smoking.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Almost completely useless!
customer_reviews.text: Just slightly better than completely useless! Bought this for flys, had it running 24/7 for over a week may have caught 4 flys. Don’t waste your money does not work! I wish Amazon had a zero star rating. The photo shows the results of one full week. Not very catchy UPDATE: After learning of my disappointment with the product the company issued a full refund! So I’m giving them an extra star
customer_reviews.author: Don Arledge

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for about 5 weeks now to combat an irritating fruit fly problem. I followed all directions and experimented with placement. I've concluded this product is a complete waste of time and money. The UV light does attract a few fruit flies but the fan and sticky pads are both totally ineffective. Save your money and stay away from this low quality Chinese garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor H

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough to work with houseflies.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product, but was let down. We have a fly problem this summer. The UV light was able to attract the flies to it, but the fan was not strong enough to suck the flies down into the chamber with the sticky disk! The flies just hung out under the light, like they were taunting us. We let it run all night and found no flies caught. We ended up using the instructional pamphlet to smack the flies manually and have killed more flies this way. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bEaNiFieD

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: This product is now a useless eyesore on top of my living room bookcases. We used it a few times when we first got it but it only caught fruit flies and we needed it for flies. The thing is, it only works in complete utter darkness. Digital clock in the kitchen? No Go. Alarm system indicator light 20 ft away? No Go. Night light so you don’t stub your toe in midnight traveling to crying children? No Go!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa H.

customer_reviews.title: it works... sorta
customer_reviews.text: It works. but. ive got a kitchen full of fruit flys. I bought the black one and just leave it on and on high 24/7. After 2 nights, this thing caught 6 (as evidenced in the glue pad). It does work.. but honestly not very well. the fan just isnt powerful enough to suck them in as much as it should be. it comes nicely packaged and all the parts work as designed. it just needs a stronger draw really. For the price, the value just isnt there for me. Catching 6 or so fruit flys out of what must be 300 or so.. is disappointing
customer_reviews.author: flyguy

customer_reviews.title: Good Company
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know where all of these glorious reviews for this product REALLY came from but something stinks! I really wanted to like this thing because I have an annoying gnat problem. With just the sticky pads NOTHING. I put a little cap of fruit juice NOTHING. Now I have some apple sauce 2 days later 3 gnats. Also it’s very high pitched and loud. I don’t mind it if it’s getting rid of the bugs...but it isn’t Update: The company has issued me a full refund without me asking. So they obviously care about customer satisfaction. So I’ll be changing my rating from 1 star to 3
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Jones

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, bright, didn't work. Might be more effective for major infestations. I noticed a few fruit flies hanging around and picked this up on sale. Didn't catch a single one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: Dont wast your money
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for two weeks now, running day and night. I see 4 fruit flies on the sticky. I still see 2 or 3 (every hour) of these flies in my face while working on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: jra80527

customer_reviews.title: Watched fruit flies walk across the glue board...
customer_reviews.text: The machine appears to work as advertised but I'm not impressed with the stickiness of the glue boards. The light did attract several flies and the fan sucked them down into the glue board area.... however, either my fruit flies have super powers or I received defective glue boards because I watched a fruit fly walking across the glue board for a full minute without getting stuck to it. You would think it would stick immediately. It should not be able to move after touching it.
customer_reviews.author: PixelBrat

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The item was super easy to set up, however, doesn't work. We just moved into a new house with a pool and mosquitos are EVERYWHERE. They make their way inside and have been biting us nonstop. I use Terminix mosquito repellent service but still we have an issue. I bought 2 of these and placed one in the kitchen and one in the master room near the pool and have had them on for three days and they have not attracted nor killed one single mosquito. This is literally just a night light. Returning both and looking for other options.
customer_reviews.author: babe ruthless

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't catch any mosquitoe
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fulfill with it's purpose. I have tried several ways of using it, I even followed the directions and it doesn't seem to catch any mosquitoes. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Catcher!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great for the very small flying bugs (Gnat-type) that somehow get into my house! They are too quick to swat during the day, and I don't use insecticides, so they had been a real annoyance to deal with. I have been running Katchy at full speed every night for 2 weeks now, and it has caught approximately 30 of the small flying bugs. I haven't had any mosquitoes inside, so don't know how it will work for those - hopefully just as good!
customer_reviews.author: SweetPea

customer_reviews.title: Beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item almost a month ago, while I thought the product worked really in the beginning, well not so much anymore. Actually the machine stopped working over all. I have the cord in and its night #2 and still not working
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge disappointment. It has barely caught anything over several days. I followed instructions to the letter. Other than the light there is nothing to attract these gnats. And with only a sticky trap it only works if the gnats go into the trap. You would need a better incentive than the only light in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Buell

customer_reviews.title: Advertised incorrectly
customer_reviews.text: This does not work for flys at all nor does the box say it does
customer_reviews.author: t man

customer_reviews.title: Works for mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: Our home is infested with mosquitoes. I bought two. One for my bedroom and one by the sliding door. I sleep aoundly with my babies knowing this machine will attract the mosquitoes before coming to us. Every morning i find about 2 mosquitoes and 0 bites. This also catches fruit flies and regular flies. It only works in the dark. It also works great as a night light. It does get dusty so a quick clorox wipe makes it new again. The refill pads come in 4. I change it every few days depending on the amount it catches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better in Concept than Practice
customer_reviews.text: Based on a month's use with a fair number of mosquitos having made it into the house, there are a few things that are evident: 1) I don't believe the suction on this device is strong enough to capture certain varities of mosquito although it does a good job with gnats and smaller pests; 2) It's debateable whether the blue light attracts them at all. Ours seem more interested in the warm tinted light from our lamps than the blue glow; 3) unless you're being swarmed you have to leave this thing on for a long time before it might catch anything;4) power cord is WAY too short. Really limits where it can be used.
customer_reviews.author: Some Random ReviewerTop Contributor: Science Fiction Books

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this trap
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this trap. It works great. Problem is, I need replacement boards and they've been unavailable. They were unavailable when I purchased the unit, but I thought they would quickly be back in stock. Meanwhile, I'm waiting and wondering.....
customer_reviews.author: nevada

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but I wouldn't buy it again or recommend it...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product, but there were too many drawbacks: 1) The unit is large. Seems a lot larger than it needs to be. 2) The unit is loud and vibrates when placed on a table (I had to use a rubber coaster to try to quiet it down). 3) The unit is very tough to clean. Dust inevitably gets sucked in, and many of the parts are inaccessible and the design elements are so tightly spaced that you can't really clean it. I ended up listing it on ebay and replacing it with a competing unit that is smaller, quieter and creates CO2 to attract mosquitoes (in addition to UV light).
customer_reviews.author: _AS

customer_reviews.title: Great Bug Catcher!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered April 15th, 2018. Received in a timely manner. Arrived complete as depicted. Actually works better than I expected. Began catching bugs right away. I noticed bugs collecting on the pad by the following evening. Will purchase again when they come available. If you got the chance to read my previous review, please know what I wrote was NOT for a Katchy Product but for an imposter product serving themselves under the Katchy Venue. I highly recommend this bug catcher from this AAA1 Seller.
customer_reviews.author: Japers

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Night Light for the nats, doesn’t kill.
customer_reviews.text: Yes I bought this item thinking it was state of the art and top shelf product...well I was deceived. Buyers beware, this did nothing for me. Had it on for a few days every night and one during the day with no success. Room was pitched black minus this UV light. How many kills do I have to show for it...0! I bought small apple traps that did a heck of a job compared to this nightlight. Don’t buy it try something else
customer_reviews.author: Luziano Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: While attempting to reduce a fruit fly issue in a restaurant, I decided to try Katchy on the shelf where they were hanging out. Hundreds of small flies were nearby and it was the only light on at night in the kitchen. Even when a fruit fly bait was added to trap, its catch rate was dismal it did catch a few other small flying bugs - so save your money. A real UV Bulb vs LED light is a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: dms2086

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it, didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this indoor insect trap was an amazing idea, it arrived, looks good, makes perfect sense, only problem, doesn't attract or catch any Mosquitoes (or anything else for that matter). I used it for several nights, placed in in several different locations, used it in enclosed spaces, tried everything. Nothing. I imagine that it may work in an area that is swarming with insects, but that would be more of a law of averages result. Sadly, cannot recommend. Pros: Nicely made, looks good, great idea. Cons: doesn't catch any insects, and certainly not any Mosquitoes. I'm returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: dognique

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I've been running it for 2 weeks, in a room I know there are mosquitoes because we hear them buzzing at night. Hasn't caught a single one. I put it outside one night, where I had gotten a bunch of bites. It did catch one there, probably by accident. Upon further reading, mosquitos aren't attracted to uv light, which was the main selling point of this product. It makes a nice night light and white noise machine. *updating to say that the company read my review and have done some pretty great customer service things to resolve my issue, so I'm adding a star because they seem like a good company.
customer_reviews.author: Crimmilator

customer_reviews.title: Get a fly swatter
customer_reviews.text: It did catch some fruit flies, but I think it was just because some unlucky ones got caught up in the suction of the fan. I dont think it had anything to do with the " ultraviolet light" supposedly supposed to attract them. I bought 5 cheap flyswatters for 3 bux, wrapped some.tape around them so they wouldn't get thru the holes and everybody in my house had a fruit fly swatting party. We got rid of them a lot quicker that way than the advanced fly killing machine here. They were all gone in 2 days. Save some money, buy some spatters and some mailing tape and swat away. It's great for stress too.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Albers

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this gadget based upon the reviews but it did not work for us. We were battling fruit flies for several weeks. In the past I tried vinegar traps with some degree of success. This time, however there were too many critters. I saw the reviews and thought this would be great. After one night, it did not attract any fruit flies. I let the unit run for one week and moved it in different rooms hoping it would catch something. After one week, I sat the vinegar traps out again and immediately started catching critters. Ultimately, the vinegar traps worked much better that this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptic Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this mess
customer_reviews.text: For what this item truly does isn’t equal to $40, I’m sorry. It catches small miniature bugs. But, standard flies are just laughing at the thing as they just fly around my jr. 1BR apartment. Even following directions from them directly, watching YouTube videos and other user reviews. It just doesn’t work for what I need it to do. No one should you pay $40 to catch these very small non bothersome bugs that are on this sticky pad. It’s laughable as I’m writing this, that I spent that type of money on this. I will say however, the product is easy to use & the design is attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio D

customer_reviews.title: SCAM - DECEPTIVE MARKETING - DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I left on vacation and forgot to throw out my bananas. While I was away a family of fruit flies invaded my home. I bought this in hopes of capturing them plugged it in and over the weekend I collect only 2 fruit flies. To top to off one of them was walking around on the sticky paper and when I opened the trap it flew away. This was completely deceptive marketing and a complete scam. Save your money and put up a sticky fly sheet. I did that and collected 21 in less than an hour. If I could rated -5 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: MN Boulevard

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase! Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: This was a total waste of money. THE ONLY THING THAT ATTRACTS BUGS IS THE UV LIGHT. If you have ANY other light source, bugs ignore it. Daylight, kitchen lights, living room lights, whatever, they find even the light from my TV more appealing. I tried for over a week (on the highest setting) and my fruit fly problem only got worse. I think this thing encourages them to breed! Worst $40 purchase I ever made!
customer_reviews.author: Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: not all it is cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: does it catch little flying pests, yes and no. over time sure you will catch the dumb ones. but I sit and watch may knats fly right around the light and then come get in my face. the fan does not suck them in. it should be a stronger vacuum or something that snatched the bastards out of the air to their sticky deaths. but if you have 10000 pesty bugs it will get 100 of them probably. not worth the ridiculously high price for this thing.
customer_reviews.author: kevin k.

customer_reviews.title: After 2-hours, caught about a dozen tiny flies.
customer_reviews.text: Moved into a new apartment. It came with a fungus gnat infection that I cannot find the source. They drive me nuts and love flying up my nose. I bought some of those zapper lightbulbs which were worthless. Bought this and two hours later have already noticed the difference. Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Hereticus

customer_reviews.title: GOOD BUT NOT GREAT. Light needs to be brighter.
customer_reviews.text: Nice size not to small not to big. Works good not great if it is in the dark with no air flow. Did catch some after 2wks there are 10 bugs. This morning before it was light I was in my office and there was a little bug flying around. I placed the catcher in the middle of my desk, turned it on high waited around two hours. I think it got it. The bug was not flying around my monitor but out about 2 ft. Next to the catcher. Best in a dark room with no one in the room and zero light.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Price
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research on Amazon and picking this one as one of the best reviewed to catch mosquitos I was highly disappointed. I bought this item before leaving for my vacations in Mexico since there is a lot of mosquitos in my town. I thought it was going to work like a champ to kill all of the mosquitos that got in the house but I was wrong. The only thing that it did manage to catch was a few fruit flies, but there was still plenty left in the kitchen. I would not buy again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Nice trap for mosquitoes (and other small pests)
customer_reviews.text: The product works well, the chunk plug was faulty, but using one of the many chunks I have at the house this was a minor inconvenience. Shipping was quick and boxing was good. It comes with 5 sticky traps for the bottom but they can fil quickly. I got it because of a gnat infestation, and they are not interested in the light...I cut the end off a banana and fit it in the center of the fan and they came quickly. There are two modes silent and strong...both are pretty quiet. It does a good job of trapping the bugs it gets but doesn’t attract flies or gnats on its own...get creative and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best fruit fly trap
customer_reviews.text: If you have a fruit fly problem this is your answer! In the past I’ve been unsuccessful or otherwise annoyed trying other methods. This trap really works and I’m so curious how it would be in situations where there are other annoying pests like mosquitos. For $45 I got the trap and some extra sticky disks. Just changed my first disk after a week and literally counted 100+ fruit flies on it! I don’t even know where they’re coming from, gross! Don’t hesitate to get rid of your problem, this does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Gockel

customer_reviews.title: Caught mosquitos and gnats, quiet
customer_reviews.text: After one night of use, I am very pleased. I set up Katchy on the higher setting, across the room in line of sight of the bed (hoping that a mosquito would be distracted from sleeping me). Very quiet fan, slight *pop* when a bug flew in. The light is rather ghostly, I wouldn't want it right next to my bed. In the morning the sticky disc had several gnattish critters and at least one mosquito! And I arose from my bed unbuzzed and unbitten. Five star product, one star off the "Value for money" rating because of the cost of the replacement sticky discs; I will probably try to improvise something cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: contranym

customer_reviews.title: Fruit flies everywhere except inside the Katchy
customer_reviews.text: I came back from vacation to a fruit fly infestation. I decided to buy this device and thought that all my problems were solved, wrong! That's a three nights of running but it's nearly nothing inside. I killed more fruit flies by hand trying to open the device then were actually in at. This is a great looking device and is very quiet but if it doesn't work what the point. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: GARTRELL WHITE

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD - save your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. It didn't kill ONE mosquito. The sticky pad didn't kill any other bugs and was completely clean. What makes me very upset is this thing was glowing in the night and I got bit by this mosquito still. I turned on the lights and found the mosquito on the wall. I had to kill it and go to sleep. Try mosquito bait around the house instead. You drop the bait in water and the mosquitos gravitate it and eat the poison and die.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Catches some (but not all) the flies
customer_reviews.text: Nice sized fly catcher that is quiet, only a little whirl. Instructions recommend only using at night when the light can attract bugs. I've tried it near potted plants that have gnats and near compost bin with fruit flies. In both situation it catches some flies overnight, but not all of them. Need to use it regularly to keep flies in check. Since it requires manual on/off every day, it is easy to forget. Would be nice if it had an auto on/off feature.
customer_reviews.author: Ted L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea and looks...but...
customer_reviews.text: This works. However, it just barely makes sense for most use cases. It has enough airflow to pull in VERY small flying insects that get near its entry. However, even a large fruit fly can sit on the intake area without getting pulled into the unit. A jar of apple cider vinegar with plastic wrap on top (and some holes just big enough for the target insects, such as fruit flies), catches about 10 times the bugs over a matching time period.
customer_reviews.author: Codemaster

customer_reviews.title: Don't listen to bad reviews!
customer_reviews.text: This works GREAT! for fruit flys and very small buggers. I put a cap of apple vinegar as per instructions on top in the middle of the vortex and it attracts and drowns them or sends the bugs down under onto a sticky pad. Sometimes reviews confuse people and don't know whom to believe, Not sure why it has bad reviewers, I guess either they are not doing it right or they have special smart bugs.LOL! Anyways it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Les Guiher

customer_reviews.title: Does not catch Mosquitos!
customer_reviews.text: So I specifically ordered this for mosquitos as the description includes mosquitos on the list of bugs that this will capture. Not a single mosquito was caught and I was still getting bit. I also did a side by side test for gnats with a DIY apple cider vinegar solution and as you can see in the photos, the solution is more effective then this machine. If you are hoping to catch mosquitos then this won't work.
customer_reviews.author: ebck120

customer_reviews.title: A product that actually works! And very well, too!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised. I cannot tell you how many products I've purchased that promise to do this thing or that and come nowhere near even being capable of it. That's not the case with this amazing little bug catcher because it actually works and I've proven it to you with a picture of the captured bugs after only one overnight use. As you can see, it's on my kitchen counter near bananas (the only fruit we have that's outside the fridge) and look what it caught! If you have a bug problem (with bugs small and lightweight enough to be sucked in), then I highly recommend the Katchy. It WORKS. The proof is in the pic!
customer_reviews.author: Christine P. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: I had complained that it didn’t come with sticky traps and the business immediately reached out and made it right. Awesome service
customer_reviews.author: T3iWuth

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't catch any mosquitos in California
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because these ankle biter mosquitos in So Cal are killing us with bites every night. I set this up in my room as directed and it has been running in the evenings for at least two to three weeks and not a single bug has been caught. Yet, I know there are bugs in my room because I have seen the small mosquitos occasionally, and I occasionally wake up with bites on my ankles. I am going to return this product.
customer_reviews.author: s. hicks

customer_reviews.title: Bug Free Home!
customer_reviews.text: We have a gnat problem because we live within a forest area. We enjoy having windows open when the weather permits, and those guys fit through screens. I was forever getting bitten from those invisible gnats that would get in our house through the screens. The first night I plugged in Katchy and I had many gnats on the sticky pad! I am going to buy another one so I will be able to catch them all! I found out they like to go by water, so I put it in the bathroom at night and I will get another one for the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Kids First

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Such a simple gadget, but works sooo well. My poor Mom was getting bit and we couldn't figure out what was biting her. Put this in the hall right in front of her room, followed the incredibly easy directions and the next day, a bunch of small mosquitos and gnats were trapped. The pic is from the one I put in the kitchen and followed the suggestion of putting a cap full of apple cider vinegar in it. It even caught moths! Great product for the price. I bought two and they both worked amazingly well. They are slightly noisy, a low hum. Nothing I can't live with. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Loret Smith

customer_reviews.title: Caught zero mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: My house had 3 mosquitos inside. 🦟 I bought this to trap them. Had it run in the room where they flew for 12 hours straight on high 3 night in a row with zero other ambient lights. Didn’t catch even one. One night I watched a mosquito fly right by it just before we turned out one side light that was on dim nearby. Mosquitos still big my family instead of flying into this trap
customer_reviews.author: avoid

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you get what you pay for!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem with The Katchy Indoor Insect Trap! It worked great! It caught lots of gnats the first night I used it! The only thing I did not like was the fact it only came with one sticky disc to catch the insects. I thought it came with more, but that’s all I got with mine. I looked to see what replacement discs would cost and could not find any to buy. All the places selling them were sold out. My review would have been five stars if I had received more sticky discs. Too much money for what I received.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy I.

customer_reviews.title: killer
customer_reviews.text: I have used this seasonally , when I see a F>>>ing Mosquito in the house I pull these out (3) and put them to work!! checked them once in a while , but don't bother emptying .. it catches any thing between Mosquitos to small moths. you know the ones that love to get into the house or pantries .. Highly recommend ! turn it on at and go to bed with out fear ..
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Day and A Mosquito is Trapped in There!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have been bitten almost every night for weeks. I am allergic to mosquito bites, so I have been in agony. I killed a few mosquitoes myself in the past week, but I saw at least one more that continued to bite us until the day we got this device. We've had it now for 2 days, and I just found a struggling mosquito on the glue pad! Amazing! I hope that was the last one in this house, but I'm feeling so much better knowing that Katchy will eventually catch those critters! It's a bit hard to see, but this first victim is right under the "H" in Katchy.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK. BLUE LIGHT DOES NOT ATTRACT ANYTHING.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for fruit flies. Barely works for mosquitoes. Kept it out all night for 2 weeks and it caught 2 mosquitoes in all. I live by on the lake and several mosquitoes enter the house every time our door is open. The blue light does not attract anything. The sticky pad on the bottom is decent I guess. Anything that does enter gets stuck in the pad. Don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: This Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: We were troubled with indoor mosquitos and purchased this product based upon the reviews. It took three days to see a difference, but WHAT A DIFFERENCE! We went from 2-3 bites per day to -0-. It is so rewarding to see the little buggers perished on the glue trap instead of circling in the air waiting for the opportunity to attack. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was having a problem with gnats/fruit flies in my house. I've tried everything you can think of. I also had a pest control company come out and take a shot at the problem. I've had this running for 18 days now. It works pretty good. My only complaint is the fan is a little on the noisy side. I'm tempted to disassemble it and replace the fan with a silenx fan. I bought 2 and they're doing a good job of killing any of the gnats that make their way into my house. See photo for results after 18 days. Check out the photo
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: For those pesty mosquitos that get you while you sleep...
customer_reviews.text: There was this bastard mosquito that has given me over 100 bites over the past 2 weeks while I was sleeping. I stayed up an hour past my bed time each night after the 30 bites he gave me the first night so I could kill him with my bare hands. However, he stayed well hidden and only came out when I fell asleep. Got this baby and ran it after I closed the blinds and left for work. Came home and what do you know? He's face planted against the adhesive pad at the bottom of the trap. Now I can move on with my life.
customer_reviews.author: Huong x Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, seriously. It helps. Ignore the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked wonders. THIS product works GREAT. We had a sudden fruit fly infestation due to some home grown tomatoes, and we tried every other trap on the market with little to no luck. On a desperate whim we bought this. I wish we had bought it sooner. We put this in our kitchen and cycled it being next to our trash can and our kitchen sink. After three days we have 0 flies left. I was a fool thinking this was too pricey, it literally did what it said it would do within the time frame it provided (3 full days). I recommend buying more sticky "Katchy" sheets if you have a real bad problem.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Rossing

customer_reviews.title: Light and efficient!
customer_reviews.text: The item is well packed and easy to set up. All you have to do is insert the sticky pad and turn it on. I bought this item to deal with a fruit fly explosion in my reptile/invert room. The flies are trying to breed in the damp soils. After using the item for 3 hours i had caught over a dozen flies. Im impressed with how efficient Katchy is. *edit* after 24 hours in the dark the device didnt catch any of the thousands of flies in my reptile room.* -2 stars for now. * I recommend this safe way to deal with unwanted flies and mosquitos to any fellow keeper
customer_reviews.author: Justin Reed

customer_reviews.title: No More Rice Moths!!
customer_reviews.text: I live in the south now and although we had some mothballs in places in Northern VA, I never had any issue with moths in the house. Now they are outside and if they get in, you can't hardly get rid of them! They eat anything! I didn't want to poison myself killing them, so kept cleaning and washing and got a catchy. Two months later I haven't seen one in weeks now. No signs of them. Catchy got every last one of them! What's great is now if anymore manage to get in, I've got my catchy now, don't even need to worry about it! Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Catches Bugs
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it will do. I run it in my kitchen at night when all of the other lights are off. The pulsing light on this is not the brightest, but when I run it at night, it attracts all of the flying insects and traps them. I see other people say that it didn't catch anything. I am not sure what they are doing wrong, but it works wonderfully for me. I advise you to use it at night when no other lights are on.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Beware of ordering from this company
customer_reviews.text: The seal was broken on the outside of the box that said if it was broken, this product should not be placed back into inventory; also, the power cable was not in its plastic bag, and it was obvious that this was a used product. I am extremely disappointed to pay this amount of money for something that was not as it was expected to be. HIGHLY frustrating! What's more, the labeling on the top of the trap says "Standard Setting" and "Low Setting" instead of what is shown on the pictures here. It appears this is an older model which they were passing off onto me! I see from the reviews that this has happened to others.
customer_reviews.author: Firerider

customer_reviews.title: Caught a fair amount of fruit flies/gnats
customer_reviews.text: We have a ton of fruit flies in our house in Southern California. This has done a great job of catching most of them. We still have some flying around but as you can see from the picture it worked well. Wish it would catch the slightly larger flies (house flies) but overall still good. When I changed the sticky mat for the first time, there were some gnats trapped In container but not on sticky pad that escaped when I opened it. Could’ve been because there were a fair amount of gnats already on the sticky pad. It was nice that it came with three replacement sticky pads but for the price, I felt like more should’ve been added.
customer_reviews.author: Reagan K. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for Texas Summers
customer_reviews.text: I have had a terrible bug problem this year. All summer was really bad for mosquitoes, fruit flies, house flies, and fleas. Every time someone would open the door, more bugs would enter. I bought this to deal with mosquitoes especially at night. My roommate wasn't giving her dogs flea medication and we found a few in the trap as well as mosquitoes, house flies, and fruit flies. It is definitely best for the insects with weaker wings. I was really pleased to not be being bit by mosquitoes at night. I read reviews about buying additional sticky pads for the bottom but have found that for our needs we didn't have to change it as often.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: I just wish that the adhesive was a little more stronger
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. But I believe the price is a little high for something like this. It's a device which sucks the bug in the fan and throws it on the adhesive at the bottom. It did catch few fruit flies in my kitchen The bad part is, some of the flies were just flying inside the thing and didn't stick to the sticky pad. And some of the flies escaped from the holes on the sides. It does have a light on top which attracts the bugs. It's a quiet fan. I just wish the adhesive was better and the holes were small.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: Worse than the last season of game of thrones.
customer_reviews.text: fancy blue light for your desk or mantle. Catches nothing and uses power doing it. After 2 months a sum total of 2 knats and 1 mosquito have drunkenly stumbled their way into this device. The fan on this thing is like a suggestion more than anything that could equate to performance. It is like telling bugs to come this way for a cooling breeze.
customer_reviews.author: TheCrowHouse

customer_reviews.title: Relief from indoor mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: My wife was getting attacked by a few indoor mosquitoes over the last few nights and was having a fairly bad reaction, so I needed to find something to eliminate the problem quickly. I was a little skeptical, but willing to try. So far, am happy with the results catching mosquitoes and gnats. There is some fan noise, but quiet enough to not be too disruptive at night. I did have an issue with a missing power adapter, but the Customer Support response was prompt, courteous the worked quickly to resolve the issue to my full satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than I expected it to!
customer_reviews.text: People either love or hate this thing, but I can say that it worked wonders for me personally. We had gnats in our kitchen where we keep indoor plants and herbs for use in cooking. No matter what we tried, they kept coming back and seemed to be multiplying exponentially. I bought the Katchy as a sort of last ditch effort and have been very pleased with it’s effectiveness. The only caveat I could possibly add is that the cable connecting it to power is relatively short, but this isn’t a problem at all in my specific case since it would have been positioned next to an outlet regardless of the cord length.
customer_reviews.author: HF

customer_reviews.title: Nosey Fruit Flies
customer_reviews.text: I’m not one to do reviews, but I feel like this one was worth it! Y’all, I could not stand all these little fruit flies in my apartment. These flies do not know how to mind their own business and loves to be nosey with everything I eat! This fruit fly catcher is the MVP! I can’t believe how well it works and how quiet it is! If you have issues with fruit flies, or any flies for that matter in your home, don’t hesitate on investing on this sucker! It’s worth it—I can now eat my food in peace!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Wang

customer_reviews.title: Super effective!
customer_reviews.text: Short version: WORKS GREAT! Long version: I bought this in October last year after a long summer of bugs in the house. In October it didn't catch much. Was that because bug season was over? My posted picture says YES. This is how many bugs it caught in one week inside my house. IF there are bugs in your house, I'll wager that this device will help. One small note for improvement. I would love to put this device on a timer and just let it do its thing, but the switch on this device doesn't work that way, i.e. it is not a latching switch.
customer_reviews.author: Dancing Geo

customer_reviews.title: Thankful
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad to find a product like this that works for our family. We live in an area that has West Nile Virus and this has helped give us "some" peace of mind. My only critique would be I wish this would cover a larger sf area. We move the unit each night to different rooms, however, to cover all areas of our home we would have to purchase at least 15 units. I hope to see a more powerful or slightly larger capable machine in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Bum

customer_reviews.title: Pointless when it comes to fruit flies/gnats. You're better off making a homemade trap off YouTube.
customer_reviews.text: Ive caught more gnats and fruit flies with my Vinegar and Dish washing liquid than I did with this $40 machine. Waste of money. I trapped well over 25 fruit flies in an hour with my home made trap and this stupid thing only caught two... TWO!
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: It works for adult fungus gnats
customer_reviews.text: I was dealing with a fungus gnat issue after bringing new plants home. At first I didn’t think the product worked. After running it for three days I hadn’t caught a thing. After four more days of running Katchy, I had caught over 30 gnats. Katchy alone will not solve the problem. I have yellow sticky traps on all of my plants. I recently treated my plants with mosquito bit tea to kill the larvae. I am glad I purchased this. I like the light and the white noise sound of the whir.
customer_reviews.author: Kassandre

customer_reviews.title: It worked ok. Not as good as the Gardner.
customer_reviews.text: I was having a horrible time with house flies and fruit flies so after reading a few reviews I decided to purchase the Katchy Indoor Insect Trap. I was so desperate I decided to purchase 2. Thankfully before purchasing the second one I read a review that a gentlemen posted after trying several different indoor insect traps. The Katchy unit was rated #2. He had rated the Gardner Flyweb Classic Fly Light as #1. I decided to purchase one of each. I am so glad I did. I have had to change the Gardner units glue card almost daily while after 5 days I changed the Katchy one even though it wasn’t necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Gnats and Flies Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Recently we were besieged by a veritable army of gnats, fruit flies and house flies. In desperation, I turned to Amazon Search for an answer and came across Katchy. I have been burned before with products that promised to eliminate an insect invasion but found little or no success with them. Katchy is different. It may not eliminate the problem immediately, but within a very short time numerous bugs became occasional bugs and we are now down to rarely seeing them at all. We do, however see dozens of their little corpses on the glue trap, which we replace regularly. Thank you, Katchy!
customer_reviews.author: must love dogs

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AMAZING! I am one of those people that mosquitoes love, they wont go after any one else if I'm around. My roommates kept leaving the doors open (for various reasons) and it got to the point where I couldn't eat a meal down stairs with out getting 3-7 bites every time. In just 2 nights of use I was extremely impressed with how many of those annoying little suckers it caught, it even got an ordinary house fly. If you're on the fence, I completely recommend this product I will always have one in my home from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little device
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida, so any little bug that can get in, will get in, and thrive. Those little gnat thingies have been driving me insane - I think they’re procreating in my house plants. I seriously put this thing out at 5pm the second it arrived, and the next morning, they were all gone. I opened the trap to see, and it was absolutely covered with them. Cannot say enough good things - the directions say it doesn’t really work for flies, but it sure works for those annoying little gnats. If those are your problem, get one and stick it by your plants.
customer_reviews.author: Kacie

customer_reviews.title: Your bite-covered legs will thank you! This thing works!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what is going on in SoCal, but we are utterly inundated with super aggressive mosquitos this year. I was at the point where I could swear I was getting bit while inside my home...so I purchased this on the recommendation of a friend. I thought this product looked like a gimmick and I would regret my purchase...but...in the first week, I had 15 mosquitos on the sticky pad! 15! In my living room! This week’s pad has 9 on it. I am utterly amazed! My legs are welt free for the first time in months. I am ecstatic.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised for fruit flies
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy setup right out of the box. The black canister can be positioned anywhere and not look out of place. No one would be aware of its purpose. For the past 18 months I have been consuming fruit and salads daily, often at my desk in the living room. In the past month I experienced a small fruit-fly infestation for the first time. Plugged in the trap on top of my printer adjacent to the desk and pressed the Standard Setting button. After 3 days the current crop of flies have been eradicated. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Dees

customer_reviews.title: Love this product - wish I could clean it more easily.
customer_reviews.text: Our infant was getting devoured by mosquitos each night until we bought our first Katchy. Almost immediately, we noticed a drop in the number of bites and over time experienced none. We bought a second for another part of the house and it works well to. Only suggested improvement: make it easier to disassemble and clean. Over time, the device gets dusts. I've used compressed air and q-tips to clean it, but it would be much more convenient if I could disassemble the main fan area to access hard-to-reach places for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: PB&J

customer_reviews.title: Gimmicky, short life, poorly made. Buy a zapper instead.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it tortures the mosquitoes that it does catch, but just not a good enough design. Very cheaply designed and manufactured. Completely dies unless you use it very sparingly. I was very unhappy with the product. I also didn't like that for $40 you have to continue buying sticky paper. The indoor/outdoor zappers are really the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Love my house plants but recently they have been invested with these small flys.. Day 1 pictured the Katchy did well I noticed a significant reduction in flys see how it goes after a week. Also to note I like how it's powered by USB looking to take it camping and hopefully it will attract mosquitos in the RV.
customer_reviews.author: Stach

customer_reviews.title: Great little device for in home use But several downfalls
customer_reviews.text: Though this product is not the end all die all it is a great small product to catch some flying Insects . It's attractive in the Room extremely quiet The only problem is very short cord that USB so inconvenient to try to plug in which makes it unattractive Price point is a bit expensive for what it is but the alternatives in other products on Facebook like it are very poor quality and usually Peter out within a few months of being plugged in Not one of my favorite purchases but it will do in the bugs are flying as a secondary
customer_reviews.author: Bg

customer_reviews.title: Solid Service
customer_reviews.text: An interesting concept for a device and for me, it works so far. I don't use it for mosquitoes, as fortunately I don't have an issue with those. However, I do have a moth problem which I use this for. I imagine though for mosquitoes, this device would be even more convenient as it dries them out and no glue boards would be necessary to 'catch' them. Very multipurpose in that way and I will be taking it out of my closet from time to time depending on the kind of bug attack! 5 stars for the customer service however. Very understanding and quick to respond!
customer_reviews.author: ekwon7

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality.
customer_reviews.text: Caught all the gnats that invaded my house like nobody's business. Went through 4 Katchy pads and it cleared my house right up. Best in dark areas with no competing light. Left it on while I was at work and came home to full glue pads. No effort at all. Just plug in and go. Fan has a low and high setting. Would recommend high. The fan isn't too loud and it becomes background noise after awhile. The fan works by sucking the bugs down into the trap when they come close enough to the purple light that attracts them to the catcher. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Calling All Gnats!! Come into the Light!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this to help control the few annoying fungus gnats I get in my small screened in plant porch. It worked great to catch the gnats in my porch; HOWEVER, it also lured every single mosquito in the area to my porch screens!! My porch screens were COVERED in mosquito like bugs!!! Needless to say, I do not recommend for an outdoor area of any size. (Yes, I do realize it was noted for indoor use.) But, WOW! It the light definitely lures in the bugs! Guess this trap is moving inside to my plant room.
customer_reviews.author: S. Asdell

customer_reviews.title: Most Amazing Bug Killing Device  Ever
customer_reviews.text: The most amazing device. With the hot weather, small bugs have been driving me nuts. Starting yesterday I ran the device next to my chair. Last night I let it run with all lights out. This morning a big collection of bugs were on the sticky board. Thank you for a great bug killing, non toxic device.
customer_reviews.author: MsNettie

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Period.
customer_reviews.text: It works just as advertised. I use it to catch gnats. And boy does it work. The bad reviews youay read about this product are guaranteed due to misuse. It's all in the directions. Anyway. I put them on at night only. Useless in the daytime. At night it does it's work. There will be a large difference in population the next morning. The more consistently you use it the better the results. It won't catch big fruit flies obviously. Use you brain people . It's a tiny fan it can't overpower anything more than gnats and mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: Finson

customer_reviews.title: Instant success!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived yesterday and the instructions said to give it a few days to work. I didn't expect much last night but woke up this morning to at least 10 mosquitoes in the trap! Awesome!!! The light is bright , but it is quiet. I wish I had bought this sooner! Our house has an indoor mosquito problem that we can't figure out. We have been using bug zapper mosquito rackets but those don't help at night when you are sleeping! With the recent occurrences of West Nile Virus in our region I decided to give in and buy this trap.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito magnet, fruit flies, meh
customer_reviews.text: Mosquitoes love this thing I always get one if it gets in the house. For fruit flies, they could care less if they have something better. Even if you take away the fruit fly’s preferred attractant they are not instantly drawn to the trap. I’m not saying doesn’t work on them but only the desperate. Not like I take a survey and ask who’s desperate and who isn’t, I just get that feeling about its performance. I haven’t bought replacement traps that people complain about their price, I thinks it’s super sticky for weeks... can’t say if that why the fruit flies aren’t eliminated quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for fruit flies and mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: With spring approaching, I noticed some mosquitoes buzzing around me while I was watching tv. Not wanting to deal with itching skin, I bought this to zap the bugs passively whilst also dealing with my fruit fly problem. I plugged this in for 4 days and to my amazement, the sticky trap filled up with fruit flies. I don’t know where they came from but it definitely killed them. Small mosquitos (ankle biters as I like to call them) also stood no match for this. I can finally get some rest.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Z

customer_reviews.title: Work Great ..Even with Gorilla Tape
customer_reviews.text: This unit is GREAT Found the refill a bit on the high side and were not in stock at the time i needed them. So I took some Gorilla Tape and taped it over juice can just over lapping a bit. Then cut it out and placed in where the disk went. Two days later I checked to see if it was working. Well the Photo shows.
customer_reviews.author: ADC224

customer_reviews.title: the only product to work for us over 5 years!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This eliminated a small fly problem we had that literally no other product would work against. We’d occassionally get these outbreaks of these flies over the last 5 years of these flies that would cover our windows. Despite the house being clean and addressing all things that could cause a fly outbreak, we couldn’t figure it out. The first night we used this there was about 10 flies stuck to the pad, after a week, you could hardly see the pad there were so many of these flies. Next thing you know, our product was solved.
customer_reviews.author: Detroit Lion Family

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought sooner
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Sucks in everything from mosquitos nats flies and more. Quick and easy to set up. Easy to clean. Stiky pads i usually leave in about 2-3 weeks depending on how dirty it gets. Done even have to touch used pad for removal just takke whole thing to trash open it and out falls the pad. Only complaint it is a bit bright and a bit noisy for night use even on low. Hard time sleeping with it on as i am a sensitive/light sleeped. Noise at night 1-10 ten high High 6/10 Low 4/10 Light (can see around in room with it on) High 7/10 Low 5/10
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Useless with fruit flies
customer_reviews.text: If you do not want to waste money, do not buy it! This is the most useless thing I got from Amazon. I bought it in order to kill fruit flies in my kitchen. It really useless! It only caught 2 fruit flies during one night! The direction showed “it works better with a cap of vinegar”. Why do I need this UV trapper if I have vinegar trapper??? Yes, it is true that I got a vinegar fruit flies trapper later, which only cost $10, and that one works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: shengning lang

customer_reviews.title: Works!  Pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love it. Plug in, turn on, and forget about it. It catches all of those pesky gnats and fruit flies. It’s really quiet, too. It doesn’t take up too much room on your counter. I can go several weeks on a sticky pad. Just leave your kitchen lights off at night to increase your odds of attracting them with the light. Price is a bit high but now that I have it, glad a sprung for it. No ugly sticky paper hanging exposed in my kitchen to catch them. Easy to move to a different area if needed.
customer_reviews.author: M Burnett

product_meta.title: KATCHY Indoor Insect Trap: Bug, Fruit Fly, Gnat, Mosquito Killer - UV Light, Fan, Sticky Glue Boards Trap Even The Tiniest Flying Bugs - No Zapper- (Black)
feature_bullets: KATCH RELIEF: with 3X TRAP POWER the UV light attracts the fruit fly, gnat, or mosquito, the fan sucks it in, and the sticky glue boards trap it.
BEAUTIFUL DESIGN: Easily place in your home kitchen, office, or outdoors as a decorative, stylish piece. No more ugly traps or fly paper.
TRAP INDOORS: Set close to insect-ridden fruit, plants or trash bin. Turn off lights for best results.
REDUCES bugs, but is not a complete insect killer lamp, and should not replace your bug repellent/control system. Does not kill house flies.
CUSTOMER SATISFACTION: If you aren't happy with the bug catcher, contact us and we will find a solution together!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars4,950 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
